meanings.definition: To strike or cut with a glaive.
meanings.sent1: He glaived the tree branches to clear a path.
meanings.sent2: The warrior glaived through the enemy lines with precision.
meanings.sent3: The chef glaived the vegetables for the stir-fry dish.
meanings.sent4: She glaived through the paperwork on her desk, finishing in record time.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor glaived away excess clay to reveal the intricate details of the statue.

meanings.definition: Having a glaive or similar weapon.
meanings.sent1: The glaived soldier stood ready for battle.
meanings.sent2: She admired the glaived knights in the historical painting.
meanings.sent3: The glaived guards protected the castle gates with vigilance.
meanings.sent4: The glaived warriors marched in unison, their weapons gleaming in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The glaived samurai displayed unmatched skill in combat.

meanings.definition: Resembling a glaive in shape or function.
meanings.sent1: The glaived polearm had a sharp blade at one end.
meanings.sent2: The glaived design of the weapon made it effective in close combat.
meanings.sent3: The glaived ornament on the shield added a touch of elegance to the armor.
meanings.sent4: The glaived spearhead was crafted with intricate patterns for decoration.
meanings.sent5: The glaived staff was both a weapon and a symbol of authority.
